messages.subject: friends over/rules discipline
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/8/2003 7:18:06 PM Central Daylight Time, ... Principles are things we live by.  They don t need to be written up as a list of to do s .
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/8/2003 7:18:06 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> Then why not just have House Principles? Principles seem a lot more
> realistic and flexible than rules. Plus with principles you need to
> think while rules you just blindly follow. I'd rather have
> thinking, principle driven kids than blindly rule following kids!

Principles are things we live by. They don't need to be written up as a list
of "to do's". House rules negate living by principles. Principles are best
lived by example and guidance, not lists of "to do" or "not to do".

Ren


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
